title: CentOS
desc:
CentOS (Community ENTerprise Operating System) is a free and open-source distribution built from the same source code used by Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL). It aims to provide a binary-compatible alternative to RHEL without the associated subscription costs. CentOS is widely used for server deployments, offering a stable and reliable platform.

Features:
  • Binary Compatibility with RHEL: CentOS strives to maintain binary compatibility with RHEL, ensuring that software developed and tested on CentOS can seamlessly run on RHEL.
  • Long-Term Support (LTS): CentOS releases receive updates and security patches for an extended period, providing stability for server environments.
  • Rock-Solid Stability: CentOS is known for its stability and reliability, making it a preferred choice for servers and critical applications.

Pros and Cons

Pros:

  • Binary compatibility with RHEL,
  • Long-term support (LTS),
  • Rock-solid stability.

Cons:

  • Delayed updates,
  • Limited desktop features.
